Package org.apache.hadoop.hbase

Interface TableDescriptors

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Closeable
All Known Implementing Classes:
FSTableDescriptors
@Private public interface TableDescriptors extends Closeable
Get, remove and modify table descriptors.

  • Method Details

    • exists

      default boolean exists(TableName tableName) throws IOException
      Test whether a given table exists, i.e, has a table descriptor.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • close

      Specified by:

      Specified by:

    • get

      TableDescriptor get(TableName tableName) throws IOException
      Returns TableDescriptor for tablename

    • getByNamespace

      Map<String,TableDescriptor> getByNamespace(String name) throws IOException
      Get Map of all NamespaceDescriptors for a given namespace.
      Returns:
      Map of all descriptors.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getAll

      Map<String,TableDescriptor> getAll() throws IOException
      Get Map of all TableDescriptors. Populates the descriptor cache as a side effect.

      Notice: the key of map is the table name which contains namespace. It was generated by TableName.getNameWithNamespaceInclAsString().
      Returns:
      Map of all descriptors.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • update

      default void update(TableDescriptor htd) throws IOException
      Add or update descriptor. Just call update(TableDescriptor, boolean) with cacheOnly as false.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • update

      void update(TableDescriptor htd, boolean cacheOnly) throws IOException
      Add or update descriptor
      Parameters:
      htd - Descriptor to set into TableDescriptors
      cacheOnly - only add the given htd to cache, without updating the storage. For example, when creating table, we will write the descriptor to fs when creating the fs layout, so we do not need to update the fs again.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • remove

      TableDescriptor remove(TableName tablename) throws IOException
      Returns Instance of table descriptor or null if none found.
      Throws:
      IOException
